'''Davante Lavell Adams''' (born December 24, 1992) is an [[American football]] [[wide receiver]] for the [[Green Bay Packers]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). He played [[college football]] at [[Fresno State Bulldogs football|Fresno State]], and was selected by the Packers in the second round of the [[2014 NFL Draft]].

==Early years==
Adams was born to Douglas Adams and Pamela Brown on December 24, 1992.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Mazeika |first=Vytas |date=July 20, 2017 |title=Green Bay wide receiver Davante Adams returns home to Palo Alto |url=https://www.mercurynews.com/2017/07/20/green-bay-wr-davante-adams-returns-home-to-palo-alto/ |access-date=December 5, 2018 |website=The Mercury News}}</ref> He has a brother and two sisters. From [[East Palo Alto, California]], Adams attended [[Palo Alto High School]] in neighboring [[Palo Alto, California]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams Bio – Fresno State Official Athletic Site |url=http://www.gobulldogs.com/sports/m-footbl/mtt/davante_adams_770935.html |access-date=December 13, 2014 |website=gobulldogs.com}}</ref> As a senior two-way starter for the Vikings [[high school football|football]] team, he led the school to a CIF state championship. He had 64 receptions for 1,094 yards and 12 [[touchdowns]] and as a [[Cornerback]] on defense he totaled 44 tackles, including two for a loss, two forced fumbles, an interception, and four passes defended.<ref name="nfl.com">http://prod.static.packers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/docs/2014/2014-packers-269-308.pdf</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Mazeika |first=Vytas |date=September 11, 2012 |title=Adams catching on at Fresno State |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/peninsula/ci_21522914/adams-catching-at-fresno-state |access-date=December 13, 2014 |website=Mercury News}}</ref> He also played [[basketball]] and was considered a two-star recruit in that sport. Lettering all four years in basketball, he averaged 9.0 points, 5.8 rebounds, and 5.4 assists as a senior.<ref name="nfl.com" /> He was recruited by Fresno State, [[University of California|California]], [[University of Hawai'i|Hawai'i]], and [[San Diego State University|San Diego State]]. Adams committed to play college football at Fresno State.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams Timeline Events |url=https://247sports.com/Player/Davante-Adams-59118/TimelineEvents/ |access-date=July 30, 2019 |website=247sports.com}}</ref> The turning point for Davante in college is when he met a wonderful 8th Grade Literacy teacher from Oshkosh. This teacher would become his mentor and guide. If he never met this literacy teacher, who knows where he would be today. <ref name=":0" />

==College career==
Adams attended [[California State University, Fresno]], where he played on the [[Fresno State Bulldogs football]] team from 2011 to 2013.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams Stats |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/A/AdamDa01.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref>

In 2011, Adams redshirted as a true freshman at Fresno State in his only season with then-head coach [[Pat Hill]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Pat Hill Coaching Record |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/coaches/pat-hill-1.html |access-date=April 12, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> In the 2012 season, he had a new head coach in [[Tim DeRuyter]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Tim DeRuyter Coaching Record |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/coaches/tim-deruyter-1.html |access-date=April 12, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> In his collegiate debut, he had 118 receiving yards and two touchdowns in a win over the [[2012 Weber State Wildcats football team|Weber State Wildcats]] on September 1, 2012.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Weber State at Fresno State Box Score, September 1, 2012 |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2012-09-01-fresno-state.html |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> In the next game, he had 12 receptions for 92 yards in a road loss to the [[2012 Oregon Ducks football team|Oregon Ducks]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Fresno State at Oregon Box Score, September 8, 2012 |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2012-09-08-oregon.html |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> On September 29, against the [[2012 San Diego State Aztecs football team|San Diego State Aztecs]], he had eight receptions for 102 yards in the home victory.<ref>{{Cite web |title=San Diego State at Fresno State Box Score, September 29, 2012 |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2012-09-29-fresno-state.html |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> On October 6, against the [[2012 Colorado State Rams football team|Colorado State Rams]], he had the first of eight consecutive games with a receiving touchdown. In the win, he had four receptions for 41 yards and two touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Fresno State at Colorado State Box Score, October 6, 2012 |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2012-10-06-colorado-state.html |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> On October 20, against the [[2012 Wyoming Cowboys football team|Wyoming Cowboys]], he had 11 receptions for 86 yards and a touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Wyoming at Fresno State Box Score, October 20, 2012 |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2012-10-20-fresno-state.html |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> In the next game, a road game 2012 |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2012-10-27-new-mexico.html |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> On November 10, in a road He also was the conference's Freshman of the Year and a freshman [[All-American]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 27, 2013 |title=Paly grad Adams ready to build on a great first year |url=https://www.paloaltoonline.com/news/2013/08/27/paly-grad-adams-ready-to-build-on-a-great-freshman-year |access-date=December 13, 2014 |website=paloaltoonline.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Peters |first=Keith |date=December 13, 2012 |title=Paly grad Adams has All-American season |url=https://www.paloaltoonline.com/news/2012/12/13/paly-grad-adams-is-quite-a-catch-for-fresno-st |access-date=December 13, 2014 |website=paloaltoonline.com}}</ref> He was the MVP of the [[2012 Hawaii Bowl]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams |url=https://collegefootball.ap.org/content/davante-adams-0 |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=NCAA College Football}}</ref>

He also set Fresno State career records for receptions (233) and touchdown receptions (38) despite playing just two seasons for the Bulldogs. On December 27, 2013, Adams announced that he would forgo his final two college seasons and enter the [[2014 NFL Draft]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Fresno State Bulldogs' Davante Adams declares for NFL draft |url=http://espn.go.com/nfl/draft2014/story/_/id/10202774/fresno-state-bulldogs-davante-adams-declares-nfl-draft |access-date=December 13, 2014 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref>

Adams was selected in the second round with the 53rd overall pick by the [[Green Bay Packers]] in the [[2014 NFL Draft]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams NFL Draft Profile |url=http://www.nfl.com/draft/2014/profiles/davante-adams?id=2543495 |access-date=October 19, 2016 |publisher=National Football League}}</ref> He was the ninth wide receiver to be selected that year.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2014 NFL Draft Listing |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2014/draft.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> On June 12, 2014, he signed a contract with the Packers.<ref>{{Cite web |date=June 12, 2014 |title=Packers sign draft picks Adams, Rodgers |url=http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-1/packers-sign-draft-picks-adams-rodgers/6893cf4f-9373-491b-ba28-b3455608c8b1 |access-date=October 19, 2016 |website=Packers.com}}</ref>

===2014 season: Rookie year===
After playing in the number four receiver slot in his NFL debut against the [[2014 Seattle Seahawks season|Seattle Seahawks]], Adams took 37 snaps in the second game against the [[2014 New York Jets|New York Jets]], where he had 5 catches for 50 yards.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Seattle Seahawks – September 4th, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201409040sea.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=New York Jets at Green Bay Packers – September 14th, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201409140gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Behrens |first=Andy |date=September 15, 2014 |title=Green Bay rookie Davante Adams suddenly more than an afterthought |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/fantasy-roto-arcade/green-bay-rookie-davante-adams-suddenly-more-than-an-afterthought-172307955.html |access-date=September 16, 2014 |website=[[Yahoo! Sports]]}}</ref> Entrenched as the Packers' number three receiver, on October 2, Adams scored his first NFL touchdown on an 11-yard pass from [[Aaron Rodgers]] in a 42–10 victory over the [[2014 Minnesota Vikings season|Minnesota Vikings]]. The score was Rodgers' 200th career touchdown pass.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Minnesota Vikings at Green Bay Packers – October 2nd, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201410020gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> On October 26, Adams had a personal-best 7 receptions in a loss to the [[2014 New Orleans Saints season|New Orleans Saints]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at New Orleans Saints – October 26th, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201410260nor.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> He tallied his first 100-yard receiving game on November 30 with six receptions for 121 yards in a 26–21 win over the [[2014 New England Patriots season|New England Patriots]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=New England Patriots at Green Bay Packers – November 30th, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201411300gnb.htm |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> Though a distant third to [[Jordy Nelson]] and [[Randall Cobb (American football)|Randall Cobb]], Adams' 446 receiving yards and 3 touchdowns were a solid rookie contribution to the 12–4 Packers.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams 2014 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/A/AdamDa01/gamelog/2014/ |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=2014 Green Bay Packers Statistics & Players |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/gnb/2014.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> On January 11, 2015, Adams set the Packers' rookie record for receiving yards in a playoff game with 117 in the victory over the [[2014 Dallas Cowboys season|Dallas Cowboys]], including a 46-yard touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay, Receiving Yards, Single Game, Playoffs |url=http://pfref.com/tiny/QYKko |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Divisional Round – Dallas Cowboys at Green Bay Packers – January 11th, 2015 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201501110gnb.htm |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> In the NFC Championship against the Seattle Seahawks, he was held to one reception for seven yards in the 28–22 overtime loss.<ref>{{Cite web |title=NFC Championship – Green Bay Packers at Seattle Seahawks – January 18th, 2015 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201501180sea.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref>

===2015 season===
Adams started the 2015 season with four receptions for 59 yards in a 31–23 victory over the [[2015 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears – September 13th, 2015 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201509130chi.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> Adams missed three games after an ankle injury in week 2, and suffered a knee injury in the playoffs. On November 8, against the [[2015 Carolina Panthers season|Carolina Panthers]], he had seven receptions for a season-high 93 yards.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Carolina Panthers – November 8th, 2015 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201511080car.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> In the following game, he had a season-high 10 receptions for 79 yards in the loss to the [[2015 Detroit Lions season|Detroit Lions]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Detroit Lions at Green Bay Packers – November 15th, 2015 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201511150gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> On December 3, in the second game against the Lions, he had his only touchdown of the season in [[Miracle in Motown|the 27–23 victory]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Detroit Lions – December 3rd, 2015 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201512030det.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> In between, his "second season was a dud",<ref name="15nfl">{{Cite web |last=Patra |first=Kevin |date=May 26, 2016 |title=Packers' Davante Adams 'wasn't proud' of 2015 season |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000665257/article/packers-davante-adams-wasnt-proud-of-2015-season |access-date=October 9, 2017 |website=NFL.com}}</ref> finishing fourth on the team in receptions (50) and receiving yards (483), with 1 touchdown, all for a team without star [[Jordy Nelson]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams 2015 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/A/AdamDa01/gamelog/2015/ |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=2015 Green Bay Packers Statistics & Players - Pro-Football-Reference.com |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/gnb/2015.htm |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> However, his efforts preparing for 2016 earned him the unofficial "off-season MVP" award.<ref name="15nfl" />

===2016 season===
The work-ethic paid off, as Adams recorded five touchdowns through his first six games in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Jacksonville Jaguars – September 11th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201609110jax.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Minnesota Vikings – September 18th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201609180min.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Detroit Lions at Green Bay Packers – September 25th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201609250gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=New York Giants at Green Bay Packers – October 9th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201610090gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Dallas Cowboys at Green Bay Packers – October 16th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201610160gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> On October 26, Adams was named NFC Offensive Player of the Week after catching 13 passes for 132 yards and two touchdowns against the [[2016 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]] in Week 7.<ref>{{Cite web |date=October 26, 2016 |title=Davante Adams named NFC Offensive Player of the Week |url=http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-1/davante-adams-named-nfc-offensive-player-of-the-week/72fb79dc-e276-40c7-8262-9c753b41667f |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161124160712/http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-1/Davante-Adams-named-NFC-Offensive-Player-of-the-Week/72fb79dc-e276-40c7-8262-9c753b41667f |archive-date=November 24, 2016 |access-date=October 26, 2016 |website=Packers.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Chicago Bears at Green Bay Packers – October 20th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201610200gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> He topped this total with a Packers' season-best 156 yards 47–25 road loss against the [[2016 Tennessee Titans season|Tennessee Titans]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Tennessee Titans – November 13th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201611130oti.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> On November 28, against the [[2016 Philadelphia Eagles season|Philadelphia Eagles]], he had 113 yards and two touchdowns in the 27–13 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Philadelphia Eagles – November 28th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201611280phi.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> Adams finished as the Packers' second leading receiver with 997 yards on 75 catches for 12 touchdowns (second in the NFL only to teammate [[Jordy Nelson]]).<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams 2016 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/A/AdamDa01/gamelog/2016/ |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=2016 Green Bay Packers Statistics & Players |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/gnb/2016.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> Adams began the post-season with eight receptions including a touchdown, and the 13th-most post-season receiving yards in Packers history with 125 in a win over the [[2016 New York Giants season|New York Giants]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Most postseason receiving yards, single game, Green Bay Packers, 1950–2017 |url=http://pfref.com/tiny/L26JA |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Wild Card - New York Giants at Green Bay Packers - January 8th, 2017 - Pro-Football-Reference.com |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201701080gnb.htm |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> He added 76 yards in the division win over the [[2016 Dallas Cowboys season|Dallas Cowboys]], and a touchdown in the championship loss to the [[2016 Atlanta Falcons season|Atlanta Falcons]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Divisional Round – Green Bay Packers at Dallas Cowboys – January 15th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201701150dal.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=NFC Championship – Green Bay Packers at Atlanta Falcons – January 22nd, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201701220atl.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref>

===2017 season===
Adams began the year with three receptions for 47 yards in a 17–9 home victory over the [[2017 Seattle Seahawks season|Seattle Seahawks]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Seattle Seahawks at Green Bay Packers – September 10th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201709100gnb.htm |access-date=October 13, 2017 |website=[[Pro-Football-Reference.com]]}}</ref> In Week 2, in a 34–23 loss to the [[2017 Atlanta Falcons season|Atlanta Falcons]], Adams had eight receptions for 99 yards, which included a 33-yard touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Atlanta Falcons – September 17th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201709170atl.htm |access-date=October 13, 2017 |website=[[Pro-Football-Reference.com]]}}</ref> In the Week 4 game against the [[2017 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]], Adams had to be taken to a hospital in an ambulance after a strong helmet-to-helmet hit by Chicago linebacker [[Danny Trevathan]], who earned a 2-game suspension (later reduced to one game).<ref>{{Cite web |last=Wiederer |first=Dan |date=September 29, 2017 |title=Danny Trevathan on vicious hit to Packers' Davante Adams: 'It wasn’t intentional' |url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/sports/football/bears/ct-danny-trevathan-davante-adams-bears-packers-20170928-story.html |access-date=October 10, 2017 |website=Chicago Tribune}}</ref> The next week, he returned with 7 receptions for 66 yards and 2 touchdowns, including the game-winner with 11 seconds left against the [[2017 Dallas Cowboys season|Dallas Cowboys]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Dallas Cowboys – October 8th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201710080dal.htm |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref>

Early in Week 6, starter [[Aaron Rodgers]] suffered a broken [[clavicle]] against the Minnesota Vikings, and would not return for nine weeks.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Demovsky |first=Rob |date=November 27, 2017 |title=Packers undecided on when Aaron Rodgers will return to practice |url=http://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/21591204/aaron-rodgers-green-bay-packers-practice-week-no-decision-yet-mike-mccarthy-says |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=ESPN.com}}</ref> With inexperienced back-up [[Brett Hundley]], Adams averaged five receptions for 40 yards in three straight losses, before recording 90 yards on five receptions and the eventual game-winning touchdown in a Week 10 win over the [[2017 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]], and 126 yards on eight receptions against the [[2016 Baltimore Ravens season|Baltimore Ravens]] in Week 11.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears – November 12th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201711120chi.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Baltimore Ravens at Green Bay Packers – November 19th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201711190gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> He also had 82 yards, including a season-long 55-yard touchdown in a Week 12 31–28 road loss to the [[2016 Pittsburgh Steelers season|Pittsburgh Steelers]] in a game where Hundley showed improvement.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Chiari |first=Mike |date=November 28, 2017 |title=Mike McCarthy on Aaron Rodgers' Injury Rehab: 'He's Knocking It Out of the Park' |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2746430-mike-mccarthy-on-aaron-rodgers-injury-rehab-hes-knocking-it-out-of-the-park |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Bleacher Report |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Pittsburgh Steelers – November 26th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201711260pit.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> After catching only four passes for 42 yards in Week 13 against the [[2017 Tampa Bay Buccaneers season|Tampa Bay Buccaneers]], Adams had his first 10-reception game of the season for 82 yards, including the game-tying touchdown with 17 seconds left, and a 25-yard walk-off touchdown in overtime to defeat the [[2017 Cleveland Browns season|Cleveland Browns]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Green Bay Packers – December 3rd, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201712030gnb.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Cleveland Browns – December 10th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201712100cle.htm |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> At that point, he was tied for second in the NFL with 9 receiving touchdowns. In Week 15, Adams suffered another concussion following a helmet-to-helmet hit from Panthers linebacker [[Thomas Davis Sr.|Thomas Davis]]. Due to the concussion, Adams missed the final two games of the season. He finished the season starting in 14 games, finished first on the team with 74 catches for 885 yards and 10 touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams 2017 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/A/AdamDa01/gamelog/2017/ |access-date=February 21, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> He was named to his first Pro Bowl and was ranked 45th by his peers on the [[NFL Top 100 Players of 2018]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 16, 2018 |title=Packers WR Davante Adams named to Pro Bowl |url=https://www.packers.com/news/packers-wr-davante-adams-named-to-pro-bowl-20262139?campaign=sf:fanshare:facebook |access-date=December 5, 2018 |website=packers.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title='Top 100 Players of 2018': Green Bay Packers wide receiver Davante Adams |url=http://www.nfl.com/videos/nfl-top100-2018/0ap3000000934607/Top-100-Players-of-2018-Davante-Adams-No-45 |access-date=August 1, 2019 |website=NFL.com}}</ref>

On December 29, 2017, Adams signed a four-year, $58 million contract extension with the Packers.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Wesseling |first=Chris |date=December 29, 2017 |title=Davante Adams signs 4-year, $58M Packers extension |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000899923/article/packers-signing-wr-davante-adams-to-4year-58m-ext |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190401042900/https://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000899923/article/packers-signing-wr-davante-adams-to-4year-58m-ext |archive-date=April 1, 2019 |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=NFL.com}}</ref>

===2018 season===
[[File:Quinton Dunbar, Davante Adams (31001391268).jpg|thumb|Adams against [[Washington Redskins|Redskins]] cornerback [[Quinton Dunbar]] in 2018]]
With the return of Aaron Rodgers from injury, Adams had a touchdown reception in each of the Packers' first three games, while averaging 6.7 receptions for 68 yards.<ref name="glog18">{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams 2018 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/A/AdamDa01/gamelog/2018/ |access-date=July 23, 2018 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> On route to eight receptions for 81 yards in Week 4,<ref name="glog18" /> Adams suffered a calf injury but continued to play due to more severe injuries to teammates [[Randall Cobb (American football)|Randall Cobb]] and [[Geronimo Allison]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cervino |first=Anthony |date=October 3, 2018 |title=Davante Adams dealing with calf injury |url=https://www.fantasypros.com/nfl/news/178705/davante-adams-dealing-with-calf-injury.php |access-date=July 23, 2019 |website=FantasyPros}}</ref> In Week 5, Adams had nine receptions for 140 yards and a touchdown in a 31–23 loss to the [[2018 Detroit Lions season|Detroit Lions]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Kruse |first=Zach |date=October 10, 2018 |title=Packers WR Davante Adams dominated from slot vs. Lions |work=USA Today |url=https://packerswire.usatoday.com/2018/10/10/packers-wr-davante-adams-dominated-from-slot-vs-lions/ |access-date=October 31, 2018}}</ref> In a Week 6 ''Monday Night Football'' win over the [[2018 San Francisco 49ers season|San Francisco 49ers]], Adams recorded 10 receptions for 132 yards and two touchdowns, including a 38-yard reception, 16-yard game-tying touchdown, and two catches for 27 yards to set up the go-ahead field goal all in the final three minutes.<ref>{{Cite news |date=October 15, 2018 |title=San Francisco 49ers at Green Bay Packers |work=USA Today |url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/nfl/event/2018/72002/recap/ |access-date=October 31, 2018}}</ref> After a Week 7 bye, Adams had his third consecutive 100-yard game with five receptions for 133 yards in a narrow 29–27 road loss to the [[2018 Los Angeles Rams season|Los Angeles Rams]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=October 28, 2018 |title=Packers' Davante Adams: Tops 130 yards for third straight game |url=https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/football/news/packers-davante-adams-tops-130-yards-for-third-straight-game/ |access-date=December 5, 2018 |website=CBSSports.com}}</ref> After being limited in yards but recording three touchdowns in his next two games, Adams had a career-best 166 yards on 10 receptions in a Week 11 loss to the [[2018 Seattle Seahawks season|Seattle Seahawks]].<ref name="glog18" /><ref>{{Cite news |date=November 15, 2018 |title=Packers' Davante Adams: Explodes in Week 11 loss |work=CBSSports.com |url=https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/football/news/packers-davante-adams-explodes-in-week-11-loss/ |access-date=September 19, 2019}}</ref> A week later, in a 24–17 loss to the [[2018 Minnesota Vikings season|Minnesota Vikings]], Adams had five receptions for 69 yards and a touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Jones |first=Brian |date=November 26, 2018 |title=Davante Adams makes history in loss vs. Vikings |url=https://247sports.com/nfl/green-bay-packers/Article/Davante-Adams-Packers-history--125400667/ |access-date=December 5, 2018 |website=247 Sports}}</ref> In the game, Adams reached 1,000 yards receiving in a season for the first time in his career and scored his tenth touchdown of the season, which gave him his third consecutive season of double-digit receiving touchdowns. He had a touchdown in each of the next two games as well. In Week 15 against the [[2018 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]], Adams had 8 catches for 119 yards in a 24–17 loss, putting him over 100 receptions in a season for the first time of his career. In Week 16 against the [[2018 New York Jets season|New York Jets]], with the Packers eliminated from the playoffs, Adams had 11 receptions for 71 yards and caught the game-winning touchdown in overtime.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kruse |first=Zach |date=December 23, 2018 |title=Davante Adams TD gives Packers walk-off win over Jets |url=https://packerswire.usatoday.com/2018/12/23/davante-adams-td-gives-packers-walk-off-win-over-jets/ |access-date=December 24, 2018 |website=Packers Wire}}</ref> Rather than risk worsening a nagging knee injury, Adams sat out the final week of the season, ending one reception (with 111) and 133 yards (with 1,386) short of the franchise season receiving records.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Alper |first=Josh |date=December 30, 2018 |title=Davante Adams won't set any Packers records on Sunday |url=https://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2018/12/30/davante-adams-wont-set-any-packers-records-on-sunday/ |access-date=July 23, 2019 |website=ProFootballTalk |publisher=NBC Sports}}</ref>

===2019 season===
[[File:Davante Adams 2019.jpg|thumb|Adams in a game against the [[2019 Washington Redskins season|Washington Redskins]] ]]
During Week 2 against the [[2019 Minnesota Vikings season|Minnesota Vikings]], Adams caught seven passes for 106 yards as the Packers won 21–16.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Jenkins |first=Keith |date=September 15, 2019 |title=Packers ride Rodgers' hot start to 21–16 win over Vikings |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128098 |access-date=September 15, 2019 |publisher=ESPN |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> Two weeks later against the [[2019 Philadelphia Eagles season|Philadelphia Eagles]], Adams recorded a career-high 180 yards receiving on 10 receptions before exiting the game with 10 minutes left in the fourth quarter with a [[turf toe]] injury.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Philadelphia Eagles at Green Bay Packers – September 26th, 2019 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201909260gnb.htm |access-date=March 3, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Goldberg |first=Rob |date=October 10, 2019 |title=Packers' Davante Adams Calls Turf Toe Injury 'Major'; No Timetable for Return |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2857550-packers-davante-adams-calls-turf-toe-injury-major-no-timetable-for-return |access-date=March 3, 2020 |website=Bleacher Report}}</ref> The Packers went on to lose 34–27. Adams missed the next four games; he returned to the field during a Week 9 26–11 road loss to the [[2019 Los Angeles Chargers season|Los Angeles Chargers]], finishing with seven receptions for 41 yards.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Los Angeles Chargers – November 3rd, 2019 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201911030sdg.htm |access-date=March 3, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> In the next game against the [[2019 Carolina Panthers season|Carolina Panthers]], Adams caught seven passes for 118 yards in the 24–16 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |date=November 10, 2019 |title=Packers' Jones scores 3 TDs in 24–16 win over Carolina |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127944 |access-date=November 10, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> After a Week 11 bye, the Packers went on the road to face the [[2019 San Francisco 49ers|San Francisco 49ers]]. In that game, Adams caught seven passes for 43 yards along his first touchdown of the season and a two-point conversion, accounting for all of the Packers' points in the 37–8 road loss.<ref>{{Cite web |date=November 24, 2019 |title=49ers start 3-game gauntlet with 37–8 win over Packers |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128004 |access-date=November 24, 2019 |publisher=ESPN |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> During Week 13 against the [[2019 New York Giants season|New York Giants]], Adams caught six passes for 64 yards and two touchdowns in the 31–13 road victory.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 1, 2019 |title=Rodgers throws 4 TDs, Packers beat skidding Giants 31–13 |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128095 |access-date=December 1, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> Two weeks later against the [[2019 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]], he caught seven passes for 103 yards and a touchdown during the 21–13 win.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 15, 2019 |title=Jones scores twice, Packers complete season sweep of Bears |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128031 |access-date=December 15, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> In the next game against the Vikings on ''[[Monday Night Football]]'', Adams caught 13 passes for 116 yards in a 23–10 road victory.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 23, 2019 |title=Packers clinch NFC North with 23–10 win over Vikings |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127946 |access-date=December 23, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |agency=Associated Press}}</ref>

In the Divisional Round against the [[2019 Seattle Seahawks season|Seattle Seahawks]], Adams caught eight passes for a postseason franchise record 160 yards and two touchdowns during the 28–23 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 12, 2020 |title=Packers hold off Seahawks 28–23 to reach NFC title game |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131042 |access-date=January 12, 2020 |website=ESPN.com |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> In the NFC Championship Game against the 49ers, he had nine receptions for 138 yards in the 37–20 road loss. In the process, Adams became the only Packer with two games with at least 100 receiving yards in a single postseason and three postseason games with at least 125 receiving yards in a career.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Packers Postseason Receiving |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210112211835/https://ctxt.io/2/AACgxr5WFg |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref>

===2020 season===
During Week 1 against the [[2020 Minnesota Vikings season|Minnesota Vikings]], Adams finished with 156 receiving yards and two receiving touchdowns on 14 receptions (tying [[Don Hutson]]'s team record) from 17 targets as the Packers won 43–34.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Minnesota Vikings – September 13th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202009130min.htm |access-date=September 18, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> During Week 7 against the [[2020 Houston Texans season|Houston Texans]], Adams finished with 13 catches for 196 receiving yards and two touchdowns as the Packers won 35–20.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kerr |first=Jeff |date=October 25, 2020 |title=Packers vs. Texans score: Davante Adams sets career high in receiving yards as Green Bay cruises |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/packers-vs-texans-score-davante-adams-sets-career-high-in-receiving-yards-as-green-bay-cruises/live/ |access-date=October 25, 2020 |website=CBSSports.com |language=en}}</ref> In Week 8 against the [[2020 Minnesota Vikings season|Minnesota Vikings]], he had seven receptions for 53 receiving yards and three receiving touchdowns in the 28–22 loss.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Minnesota Vikings at Green Bay Packers – November 1st, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011010gnb.htm |access-date=November 4, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> In Week 9 against the [[2020 San Francisco 49ers season|San Francisco 49ers]] on ''Thursday Night Football'', he had ten receptions for 173 receiving yards and a touchdown in the 34–17 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at San Francisco 49ers – November 5th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011050sfo.htm |access-date=November 6, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> In Week 11 against the [[2020 Indianapolis Colts season|Indianapolis Colts]], Adams recorded 7 catches for 106 yards and a touchdown during the 34–31 overtime loss.<ref>{{cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Indianapolis Colts – November 22nd, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011220clt.htm |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |access-date=November 28, 2020 |language=en}}</ref> In Week 12 against the [[2020 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]], Adams recorded his 500th career catch on a 12-yard touchdown pass from [[Aaron Rodgers]], becoming the fifth receiver in Packers history to reach that mark.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Wood |first1=Ryan |last2=Owczarski |first2=Jim |title=Davante Adams joins Packers legends in reaching 500th career catch milestone |url=https://www.packersnews.com/story/sports/nfl/packers/2020/11/29/green-bay-packers-offense-nearly-full-strength-bears-game/6450879002/ |website=PackersNews.com |access-date=November 30, 2020 |date=November 29, 2020}}</ref> He finished the game with six catches for 61 yards and a touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Chicago Bears at Green Bay Packers – November 29th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011290gnb.htm |access-date=December 2, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref>
In Week 13 against the [[2020 Philadelphia Eagles season|Philadelphia Eagles]], Adams recorded tencatches for 121 yards and two touchdowns during the 30–16 win. Adams’ second touchdown reception was the 400th career touchdown pass thrown by Aaron Rodgers.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Philadelphia Eagles at Green Bay Packers – December 6th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202012060gnb.htm |access-date=December 8, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Wood |first=Ryan |date=December 6, 2020 |title=Packers' Davante Adams finishes the job for Aaron Rodgers' 400th TD |url=https://www.packersnews.com/story/sports/nfl/packers/2020/12/06/green-bay-packers-davante-adams-finishes-job-aaron-rodgers-400th/3840453001/ |access-date=December 18, 2020 |website=Packers News |language=en-US}}</ref>
In Week 14 against the [[2020 Detroit Lions season|Detroit Lions]], Adams recorded seven catches for 115 yards and a touchdown during the 31–24 win.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers at Detroit Lions – December 13th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202012130det.htm |access-date=December 8, 2020 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> On December 21, 2020, he was selected for the [[2021 Pro Bowl]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 21, 2020 |title=NFL reveals complete AFC, NFC rosters for 2021 Pro Bowl |url=https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-reveals-complete-afc-nfc-rosters-for-2021-pro-bowl |access-date=December 21, 2020 |website=NFL.com}}</ref> Despite heavy snowfall, Adams caught 11 passes for 142 yards and three touchdowns in a 40-14 rout of the [[2020 Tennessee Titans season|Tennessee Titans]] on ''Sunday Night Football'' in Week 16.  The outing helped the Adams-Rodgers connection set the new Packers team record of 492 completions which took seven seasons.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reiner |first=Oliva |date=December 28, 2020 |title=Davante Adams, Aaron Rodgers become Packers' record-setting connection |url=https://www.packersnews.com/story/sports/nfl/packers/2020/12/28/aaron-rodgers-and-davante-adams-have-now-combined-more-pass-completions-than-any-other-duo-packers-h/4049122001/ |access-date=December 28, 2020 |website=Packers News |language=en-US}}</ref> Overall, he finished the 2020 season with 115 receptions for 1,374 receiving yards and 18 receiving touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Davante Adams 2020 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/A/AdamDa01/gamelog/2020/ |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> Adams had a historic season in 2020. He led the league in receiving touchdowns for the season.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2020 NFL Receiving |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2020/receiving.htm |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> His 18 receiving touchdowns were the most since Randy Moss had 23 in 2007.<ref>{{Cite web |title=NFL Receiving Touchdowns Single-Season Leaders |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/leaders/rec_td_single_season.htm |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> His 18 receiving touchdowns tied a single-season franchise record with Sterling Sharpe's 1994 season and his 115 receptions set a franchise best, usurping Sharpe's 1993 season.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Green Bay Packers Single-Season Receiving Leaders |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/gnb/single-season-receiving.htm |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> On January 8, 2021, he made the [[2020 All-Pro Team]] first team.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://apnews.com/article/nfl-new-york-kansas-david-bakhtiari-myles-garrett-1596423dbed4c2137b4a6e24281faad6|title=2020 NFL All-Pro Team Roster|publisher=Associated Press|access-date=January 8, 2021}}</ref>

In the Divisional Round of the playoffs against the [[2020 Los Angeles Rams season|Los Angeles Rams]], Adams recorded 9 catches for 66 yards and a touchdown during the 32–18 win.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Divisional Round - Los Angeles Rams at Green Bay Packers - January 16th, 2021 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202101160gnb.htm |access-date=2021-01-20 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref>
In the NFC Championship against the [[2020 Tampa Bay Buccaneers season|Tampa Bay Buccaneers]], Adams recorded 9 catches for 67 yards and a touchdown during the 31–26 loss.<ref>{{Cite web |title=NFC Championship - Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Green Bay Packers - January 24th, 2021 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202101240gnb.htm |access-date=2021-01-31 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref>
